title: Yuri Dmitriev, the Russian historian imprisoned for denouncing Kremlin attempts to rewrite history
subhead: Detained in a penal colony in Mordovia, the 70-year-old historian, who specializes in the Stalin regime's crimes, is one of Russia's oldest political prisoners. His crime? Refusing to accept historical falsifications that the Kremlin aims to impose on public opinion.

title: US Senate rejects vote to avert government shutdown
A growing number of teenagers in Russia are being sentenced for 'terrorism'
'Europe's housing crisis is a democratic time bomb'
subhead: Young people across many European regions are struggling to access decent housing, observes Marie Charrel in her column. The difficulties and frustrations this causes have clear political consequences.

title: Social media ban for under-15s: 'Parents are being asked to do the dirty work that the government has refused to impose'
subhead: In every sector related to public health, it is up to the manufacturer to demonstrate the safety of their product before it goes on the market, neuroscientist Thibaud Dumas reminds us in this op-ed for Le Monde. Digital platforms should not be exempt from this logic.

title: Melania Trump's documentary premieres at the Kennedy Center ahead of global release
subhead: The documentary, titled simply 'Melania,' was funded by a multi-million-dollar deal with Amazon, eliciting accusations that Jeff Bezos is attempting to curry favor with the US president.

title: China's crackdown on a village of defiant Christians
subhead: Videos, testimonies and satellite footage obtained by Le Monde reveal the scale of the crackdown targeting part of the Chinese Christian community.

title: US eases Venezuela sanctions after oil sector reforms
Sensorion, the biotech company that specializes in childhood deafness, increases its capital
Brazil's highly politicized and polarized wardrobes
Trump's new Minneapolis point man vows 'smarter' operation
Morocco unveils plans for a giant film city on the outskirts of Rabat
Starmer hails 'good progress' after meeting China's Xi
Trump says Putin agreed not to attack freezing Kyiv for a week
At the Paris Opera, Ralph Fiennes brings refined pleasures to 'Eugene Onegin'
'The only thing left to do is leave': Cuba pushed to the brink
Former Kurdish-led fighters and Damascus test a fragile 'reconciliation' in northeastern Syria
PFAS: Pollution in the EU could cost up to €1.7 trillion
Trump ramps up pressure on Iran by deploying aircraft carrier and threatening strikes
Havana, a ghost town battered by shortages and US threats
subhead: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (1/3) In the small socialist country, US pressure for regime change has reached its peak since the kidnapping of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro on January 3. Daily life has become a nightmare, and public discourse is more closely monitored than ever.

title: Veteran civil servant Xavier Piechaczyk to head Paris public transports
subhead: France's Parliament approved President Emmanuel Macron's nominee to head the RATP on Wednesday. The appointment now awaits formal confirmation by decree.

title: 'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
subhead: During his speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French president delivered a common English phrase – in a strong accent – that achieved global fame.

title: The need to speak truth about immigration
Europe: 'A new social federalism must be invented as the response of democratic states to empires'
John Bolton: 'Toppling the Iranian regime is the most effective way to remove the terrorist threat the West has faced'
